p:
Cell membrane permeability was determined by measuring EC. Five mycelial disks, taken from the plates of four tested pathogenic fungi ( M. fructicola, A. niger, P. expansum, and B. cinerea) were transferred into liquid PDB medium and cultured for 3 days at 28 °C and 175 rpm. One gram of mycelia was blended with 20 mL of 250, 500, 1000, and 2000 μg/mL EO and stored at room temperature (20 ± 2 °C). The EC values of the solutions were determined after 30, 60, 90, 120, and 150 min of incubation. The IP of the EC value has been measure using the following equation:
(2)
IP =
E .
C t
E .
C ctrl
× 100
where E.Ct is the EC value of the treated sample and E.C ctrl is the EC value of the PDB broth culture.
